content: Hi all! I've got a lot of time on my hands given the Mozilla events of earlier this week, and it's been a few years since my last contribution to rustc (apart from my experiments around MSVC heap profiling in https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/68076). I'm particularly interested in improving the debugger experience and fixing ICEs, but I'd also like to know: what areas could benefit from more hands?
(I've moved this into it's own topic from #new members > Hi from caranatar)
Thanks. I haven't quite got the hang of Zulip's interface yet, apparently.
Hi @jdm! There is a A-debuginfo label. @eddyb has done some work on debuginfo a few months ago. Other than that is is unfortunately quite unmaintained.
Sounds like there's an abyss-gazing expert vacancy that could be dangerously me-shaped.
they are working on an issue i sent them :stuck_out_tongue:
